DataElement.preferredName: Protocol Yes or No Response Randomization Indicator java.lang.Boolean
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An action plan for a clinical trial.  The plan states what the study will do, how, and why.  It explains how many people will be in it, who is eligible to participate, what study agents or other interventions they will be given, what tests they will receive and how often, and what information will be gathered._A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.:An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a study is randomized._Generic value domain for a primitive java datatype that is a Boolean value (true or false).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Protocol Yes or No Response Randomization Indicator
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An action plan for a clinical trial.  The plan states what the study will do, how, and why.  It explains how many people will be in it, who is eligible to participate, what study agents or other interventions they will be given, what tests they will receive and how often, and what information will be gathered._A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.:An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a study is randomized.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action plan for a clinical trial.  The plan states what the study will do, how, and why.  It explains how many people will be in it, who is eligible to participate, what study agents or other interventions they will be given, what tests they will receive and how often, and what information will be gathered.

Concepts.definition: A formal document that describes a complete plan of research activity in the framework of a clinical study; specifically, the study objective(s), design, methodology, eligibility requests for prospective subjects and controls; intervention regimen(s), proposed methods of analysis of data; statistical considerations, and organization of the study. The protocol usually also provides the background and rationale for the study, but these could be represented in other protocol referenced documents.

Property.preferredName: Yes or No Response Randomization Indicator
Property.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.:An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a study is randomized.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a study is randomized.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Generic value domain for a primitive java datatype that is a Boolean value (true or false).

ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: 10.14.20 TL changed WFS from DRAFT NEW to RETIRED ARCHIVED and added an End Date in preparation of OneData.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Data Element Protocol Yes or No Response Randomization Indicator java.lang.Boolean does not have Preferred Question Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Data Element Protocol Yes or No Response Randomization Indicator java.lang.Boolean does not have Preferred Question Text

ReferenceDocuments.name: BRIDG UML Definition Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: NOTE: We are assuming that a document is a container, which may be physical or logical, with the six characteristics listed in the definition of the Document class.  This class is the container for the Plan. NOTE: StudyProtocol describes the pre-study, study, and post-study portions of the plan.
